Australia: First Prussian settlers arrived in South Australia; the largest group of non-British migrants in Australia at the time.
Belgium: Hendrik Conscience's De Leeuw van Vlaenderen published.
Bhutan: British mission to Thimphu offers Bhutan a treaty providing for the extradition of Bhutanese officials responsible for incursions into Assam, free and unrestricted commerce between India and Bhutan, and settlement of Bhutan's debt to the British. In an attempt to protect its independence, Bhutan rejected the British offer.
Haiti: Haiti's remaining debt to France, 120 million francs, is reduced to 60 million francs
Mexico:
• The remains of Agustín de Iturbide are transferred to the Metropolitan Cathedral of Mexico City in a sumptuous procession.
  • In the Metropolitan Cathedral of Mexico City, the funeral honors and the burial of the remains of Agustín de Iturbide take place.
Slovenia: First works, tracings on Slovene territory of a railway route Vienna – Trieste in a so-called "Southern Railway" (Južna železnica) begin.
